seo.title: Services | SustainSage
seo.description: Explore bilingual, ICF-aligned coaching formats designed for UK-based transitions. SustainSage supports individuals, teams, and communities with calm, ethical structures.

hero.title: Coaching formats that fit real life
hero.subtitle: Simple structures, clear boundaries, and bilingual support. We begin by understanding your needs, then choose a rhythm together.
hero.note: Coaching is collaborative. We do not guarantee outcomes or replace therapy, legal, immigration, medical, or financial advice.
hero.primaryCtaAria: Book an intro session with SustainSage

individual.title: Individual coaching packages
individual.intro: Each package begins with an intro call to confirm scope, language, and consent. Choose the container that matches your transition.

packages.title: Transition Series · 6 sessions
packages.description: Structured support through a defined life or work shift in the UK context.
packages.details: Ideal if you are navigating relocation, role changes, or returning to work and want steady reflection.

packages.title: Early-career Exploration · 6 sessions
packages.description: A bilingual space to test options, rebuild confidence, and design experiments without pressure.
packages.details: Useful for graduates, newcomers, or career shifters balancing visas, family, or finances.

packages.title: Sustain & Balance · 8 sessions
packages.description: Longer partnerships for leaders, carers, or founders who want reflective accountability across a season.
packages.details: Suited to those balancing complex responsibilities who value ongoing check-ins.

packages.title: Single deep dive · 90 minutes
packages.description: One focused conversation to map options, prepare for a pivotal conversation, or clarify boundaries.
packages.details: Works well before interviews, negotiations, or when you need a structured thinking space.

for: You are mid-transition — relocation, visa change, returning after leave, or reshaping your role in the UK.
You want accountability that respects capacity, caregiving, and time zones.
You prefer experiments you choose, not homework assigned to you.
includes: 6 x 50-minute coaching sessions across 6–8 weeks, online or hybrid.
Optional light check-ins with consented boundaries (no constant messaging).
Session notes summarising key themes and chosen experiments when useful.
outcomes: A grounded story about your transition that you can share with stakeholders.
1–2 client-chosen experiments between sessions to gather evidence.
Clarity on what support you need next — whether coaching continues or not.
not: No job, visa, or promotion guarantees.
Not a substitute for therapy, legal, immigration, medical, or financial advice.

anchorSections.title: Transition Series · 6 sessions
anchorSections.intro: A six-session arc to help you design and test your own way forward during UK-based life and career shifts.
suitable: Professionals returning after leave or relocation and needing a steady plan.
People balancing visas, caregiving, or part-time work while making decisions.
Those wanting bilingual space to integrate cross-border experiences.
Clients who value accountability without pressure.
conversation: Check reality against expectations so decisions are grounded in current capacity.
Explore perspectives, cultural scripts, and options you may not have voiced aloud.
Design client-owned experiments with explicit consent on size and timing.
structure: Session 1: Define success, boundaries, and what support looks like to you.
Session 2: Surface patterns and stabilisers in your current context.
Session 3: Explore possibilities and stakeholders, translating across cultures.
Session 4: Decide on 1–2 experiments and rehearse language or boundaries.
Session 5: Review experiments, adapt pace, and address emerging hurdles.
Session 6: Harvest learning, plan support, and decide whether to pause or continue.
not: Guarantee specific job offers, visas, or salary outcomes.
Replace therapy, counselling, or other regulated professional services.
Provide ready-made answers without your input.

anchorSections.title: Early-career Exploration · 6 sessions
anchorSections.intro: For graduates, newcomers, and career shifters who want space to experiment thoughtfully while navigating UK systems.
suitable: Graduates on Graduate or Skilled Worker visas wanting sustainable plans.
Professionals exploring UK sectors, networking, or further study options.
Clients juggling family expectations, finances, or wellbeing alongside decisions.
conversation: Debrief interviews, applications, or networking without judgement.
Practise bilingual narratives that feel authentic and culturally aware.
Name confidence dips, impostor stories, and design doable experiments.
structure: Session 1: Map what you want to explore and how you will measure ‘useful’.
Session 2: Clarify values, strengths, and constraints in the UK context.
Session 3: Prototype possibilities and scripts for outreach or boundaries.
Session 4: Review evidence gathered, adjust experiments, and honour rest.
Session 5: Prepare decisions or conversations with stakeholders.
Session 6: Integrate learning, plan next support, and celebrate progress.
not: Write CVs, cover letters, or personal statements for you.
Guarantee sponsorship, offers, or academic acceptance.
Push hustle tactics that ignore wellbeing or consent.

anchorSections.title: Sustain & Balance · 8 sessions
anchorSections.intro: For leaders, carers, and founders who need a longer arc to integrate strategy, wellbeing, and community commitments.
suitable: Leaders balancing organisational responsibilities with personal transitions.
Caregivers or sandwich-generation professionals needing sustained reflection.
Founders or community builders working across cultures who want ethical challenge partners.
conversation: Examine impact, influence, and boundaries across stakeholders.

structure: Session 1: Co-create agreements, rhythms, and safeguarding needs.
Sessions 2-3: Map current landscape, tensions, and desired influence.
Sessions 4-5: Prototype strategic and personal experiments; rehearse critical conversations.

organisation.title: Support for organisations & schools
organisation.intro: We design bilingual coaching and reflective workshops that protect psychological safety and align with your policies.
points: Co-create group coaching series or workshops that balance cultural nuance with clear ground rules.
Partner on ethical frameworks, referral pathways, and consent processes for your teams or students.
Provide bilingual summaries so stakeholders can continue the work between sessions without losing context.
Signpost wellbeing, counselling, or legal resources when coaching is not the right fit.

howItWorks.title: How coaching works
howItWorks.intro: Four steady stages help us protect ethics, consent, and pacing.

steps.title: Intro call
steps.description: 20 minutes to understand context, outline expectations, and see if coaching is appropriate.

steps.title: Agreement
steps.description: We co-create contracts, boundaries, safeguarding plans, and fees before any paid session.

steps.title: Sessions
steps.description: 40–60 minute conversations online (or in-person when possible). You lead the agenda; we bring reflection and cultural translation.

steps.title: Review
steps.description: We examine learning, celebrate experiments, and decide whether to continue, pause, or close — no pressure either way.

practical.title: Practical information
practical.intro: Transparency helps you plan. We confirm details in writing before work begins.
items: Sessions run online or in person across the UK when schedules allow.
Languages available: English, Traditional Chinese, Simplified Chinese, or a blend.
We operate primarily in UK time (GMT/BST) and can discuss alternatives for international clients.
Fees are shared after the intro call with clear scopes; sliding scales exist for community-led work.

faqSnippet.title: Good to know
faqSnippet.intro: A few common questions before we meet.

items.question: How soon can we start?
items.answer: Intro calls are usually available within two UK working weeks. Coaching begins once agreements are signed.

items.question: Do you coach in mixed languages?
items.answer: Yes. Many clients switch languages mid-session; we will check what feels most comfortable for you.

items.question: Will we receive documentation?
items.answer: You will receive summaries of agreements, safeguarding boundaries, and optional reflection notes after sessions.

cta.title: Start with a conversation
cta.body: Share what you are navigating and we will outline formats—or signpost other support—so you can choose confidently.
